figures.description: Short‑run cost and revenue diagram for Question 7. Vertical axis: price/cost; horizontal axis: quantity. A downward‑sloping demand curve, a marginal‑revenue curve, and U‑shaped MC and AC curves are drawn. Profit‑maximizing output is at Q₂ where MR = MC.

Opportunity‑cost table for Question 38. Combinations of beans and rice (in units): K → (15, 19); L → (20, 17); M → (24, 16). Movement from combination K to L implies giving up some rice to gain more beans.

Demand–supply shift diagram for Question 44. Initial demand D₁ and supply S₁ intersect at E₁. New demand curve D₂ and new supply curve S₂ intersect at a different equilibrium E₃. Points E₁–E₅ indicate alternative equilibria.
Supply curve S shifting rightward from T to N for Questions 45–46. At the same demand curve, this indicates an increase in supply leading to lower equilibrium price and higher quantity.

instructions.text: In each of questions 1 to 50, choose the option that best answers the question or completes the statement.

questions.question: By advertising, a monopolistic competitive firm tries to shift its
questions.explanation: Advertising aims to **increase demand** for the firm’s differentiated product, shifting its demand curve to the right.

questions.question: Given that \(Y = C + I\) and \(C = bY\) where \(b = 0.8\), what is the multiplier?
questions.explanation: Marginal propensity to consume \(MPC = b = 0.8\). Multiplier \(k = 1/(1-MPC) = 1/(1-0.8) = 1/0.2 = 5\).

questions.question: The role of the Central Bank in the economic development of Nigeria is to

options.text: give short‑ and medium‑term loans to the public
give financial and technical advice to customers
use cheques and bank drafts to facilitate business transactions

questions.explanation: A key role of the Central Bank is **monetary stability**, i.e. maintaining price stability.

questions.question: The primary function of non‑bank financial institutions is to
questions.explanation: Institutions like insurance companies and pension funds **mobilize savings** and channel them into investment.

questions.question: At the maximum point of the total product curve of a firm, marginal revenue is
questions.explanation: At the maximum of total product, **marginal product is zero**. If the firm sells at a constant price, marginal revenue product at that point is also zero.

questions.question: In an open economy, the GNP is measured as
questions.explanation: For an open economy without government transfers, **GNP = C + I + G + (X − M)**.

questions.question: The diagram (figure Econ2004_Monopoly_SR) represents the short‑run position of a monopolist. The profit‑maximizing output is at
questions.explanation: A monopolist maximizes profit where **MR = MC**; in the diagram this occurs at \(Q_2\).

questions.question: The capital market provides business firms with the avenue to
questions.explanation: Capital markets are for **long‑term financing** (shares, bonds).

questions.question: Which of the financial institutions is charged with the formulation of monetary policies in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The **Central Bank of Nigeria** is responsible for monetary policy.

questions.question: GDP differs from GNP because GDP

options.text: emphasizes the final goods and services produced within the country in a particular period
emphasizes the market value of all final goods and services produced by nationals
emphasizes the market value of all final goods and services produced by nationals anywhere

questions.explanation: GDP counts production **within a country’s borders**, regardless of ownership.

questions.question: The distinction between perfect competition and monopolistic competition is that the latter is characterized by
questions.explanation: In monopolistic competition, firms sell **differentiated products**.

questions.question: The downstream activities of oil companies in Nigeria involve
questions.explanation: Downstream operations include **refining, marketing and distribution**.

questions.question: The movement of goods and services from the producers to the consumers is referred to as
questions.explanation: This is the **distribution (or marketing) channel**.

questions.question: The purpose of conducting a census is to enable a country to

options.text: plan her capital inflow and outflow
determine the growth rate of population
determine the optimum level of population

questions.explanation: Accurate population data are crucial for **development planning**.

questions.question: A major cause of the slow pace of industrialization in Nigeria is inadequate
questions.explanation: Industrialization is hindered by **shortage of skilled manpower and technical know‑how**.

questions.question: The maximum wage legislation seeks to

options.text: fix wages above the equilibrium wage rate
set wages below the equilibrium wage rate
deter employers from exploiting their employees
ensure an upper limit to the wages payable

questions.explanation: A **maximum (ceiling) wage** law sets an upper bound on wages.

questions.question: The marketing of agricultural commodities in Nigeria is hampered by
questions.explanation: Poor **storage and preservation** facilities cause wastage and unstable supply.

questions.question: Import duty concessions on industrial inputs directly benefit the
questions.explanation: Lower duties on inputs reduce production costs, benefiting **manufacturers**.

questions.question: The labour force in Nigeria falls between the ages of
questions.explanation: The official Nigerian working‑age population is typically **18–60 years**.

questions.question: Government’s involvement in agricultural business in Nigeria is most manifested in the

options.text: establishment of farm settlements in each state of the federation
establishment of credit guarantee schemes for small‑scale farmers

questions.explanation: One prominent involvement has been **buying and distributing fertilizers** to farmers.

questions.question: The difference between birth and death rates of a given population is referred to as the
questions.explanation: Birth rate minus death rate gives the **natural increase (growth) rate**.

questions.question: Fiscal policy is the government’s plan to control aggregate demand by manipulating

options.text: the demand and supply of money
the structure of production and employment

questions.explanation: Fiscal policy works through **taxation and government spending**.

questions.question: A country is said to have absolute advantage when she

options.text: has a higher opportunity cost in the production of a good
can sell to other countries without buying from them
can produce more of any good with fewer resources
has a lower opportunity cost in the production of a good

questions.explanation: Absolute advantage means being able to produce **more output with the same resources** (or same output with fewer resources).

questions.question: The European Union was formed to promote free trade within member nations by

options.text: promoting free trade within member nations
promoting economic integration in non‑member countries
assisting countries to achieve their economic goals
financing development projects in member nations

questions.explanation: EU’s main objective is **economic integration and free movement** among member countries.

questions.question: If budget deficits are financed by borrowing, the crowding‑out effects can be offset by an increase in
questions.explanation: Higher **private savings** provide funds for both government and private investment, reducing crowding‑out.

questions.question: When the importation of a commodity is limited to a definite quantity, the trade‑control measure used is known as
questions.explanation: A **quota** is a quantitative limit on imports.

questions.question: The excess of aggregate expenditure over full‑employment level of output is referred to as
questions.explanation: When planned spending exceeds full‑employment output, there is an **inflationary gap**.

questions.question: The tax levied on goods and services at each stage of production is
questions.explanation: **Value Added Tax (VAT)** is charged at each stage of production/distribution.

questions.question: The number of shareholders in a private limited liability company ranges from
questions.explanation: In many jurisdictions including Nigeria, a private company must have **2–50 shareholders**.

questions.question: A major reason for having national development plans is to

options.text: ensure efficient use of available resources
make government spend more on production
ensure that more citizens are involved in planning

questions.explanation: Planning seeks to allocate scarce resources **efficiently** among competing uses.

questions.question: The difference between payments and receipts for visible trade is called
questions.explanation: Balance of trade = **exports of goods − imports of goods**.

questions.question: One of the causes of the present high rate of inflation in Nigeria is
questions.explanation: Rising input costs (wages, energy, imported materials) lead to **cost‑push inflation**.

questions.question: The final stage in the production process of any commodity involves its movement from the
questions.explanation: Production is complete when the good reaches the **final consumer**.

questions.question: A change in demand for a normal good means

options.text: a shift in the demand curve
a change in the price elasticity
the demand changes as price changes
a movement along a given demand curve

questions.explanation: ‘Change in demand’ means the **whole demand curve shifts** due to non‑price factors.

questions.question: In the indifference‑curve diagram (three curves I, II, III and budget line S₁), a rational consumer will choose to consume at point
questions.explanation: Optimal choice is where the highest attainable indifference curve is **tangent to the budget line**; that point is J.

questions.question: In order to increase revenue, the seller of a commodity whose demand is fairly elastic is advised to
questions.explanation: With **elastic demand (|E_d|>1)**, a price reduction causes proportionately larger increase in quantity demanded, increasing total revenue.

questions.question: In any set of data, the median represents the

options.text: value that is most representative of the data
mid‑position when the values are arranged in ascending or descending order
mid‑position when the values are arranged randomly
difference between the highest and lowest values

questions.explanation: The **median** is the middle observation after arranging data in order.

questions.question:
The table below shows the combinations of beans and rice that can be purchased by a consumer:
K: (15 beans, 19 rice), L: (20 beans, 17 rice), M: (24 beans, 16 rice).
The opportunity cost of moving from K to L is
questions.explanation: Move K→L: beans increase by 5, rice falls from 19 to 17. Opportunity cost of 5 extra beans is **2 units of rice**.

questions.question: One of the assumptions of ordinal utility in consumer behaviour is that
questions.explanation: Ordinal utility assumes that utility **cannot be measured**, only **ranked** by preference order.

questions.question: A large standard deviation is an indication of

options.text: a wide spread around the mean
a wide difference between the mean and the mode
the difference between the highest and the lowest values

questions.explanation: Standard deviation measures **dispersion of observations around the mean**; a large value implies wide spread.

questions.question: A major characteristic of a mixed economy is that

options.text: economic decisions are made by both the rich and the poor
both primary and secondary production are undertaken
the federal and the state governments undertake joint projects
economic activities are undertaken by both the public and private sectors

questions.explanation: In a **mixed economy**, both government and private sector play important roles in production.

questions.question: Given the cost function \(C = 160 + 36Q\), what is the average cost at 20 units of output?
If an increase in the price of good X leads to an increase in the supply of good Y, X and Y are said to be
questions.explanation: Producers shift resources from X to Y when X becomes relatively more profitable; goods are **competitive in supply**.

questions.question: The diagram with shifts in both demand and supply curves (figure Econ2004_Shift_DemandSupply) shows new equilibrium points E₁–E₅. What is the new equilibrium point after the shifts?
questions.explanation: The new demand curve D₂ intersects new supply S₂ at **E₃**.

questions.question: Referring to the supply‑shift diagram (figure Econ2004_Supply_Shift_TN), when there is a change from point T to N along the supply curve, it implies that
questions.explanation: Movement **along** an unchanged supply curve from T to N shows an increase in **quantity supplied** due to higher price.

questions.question: A movement from point M to T on the same diagram implies that there has been
questions.explanation: Moving upward along a supply curve (M→T) represents a **rise in price** and quantity supplied.

questions.question: A necessary condition for specialization in an economy is the existence of
questions.explanation: Specialization requires **money (a medium of exchange)** to overcome the problem of barter.

questions.question: A firm operating at full capacity will experience rising short‑run total costs when

options.text: prices of its variable inputs rise
prices of its variable inputs fall
there is a change in management

questions.explanation: Higher prices of variable inputs (e.g. wages, raw materials) raise **short‑run total cost**.

questions.question: In a textile factory, the cost of cotton used is a typical example of
questions.explanation: Cotton usage varies with output; it is a **variable cost**.

questions.question: A black market can occur when

options.text: supply is in excess of demand
consumption of the commodity is restricted
prices are set by government above the equilibrium
prices are set by government below the equilibrium

questions.explanation: A government‑imposed **price ceiling below equilibrium** creates shortages and encourages black‑market selling at higher prices.
